Description: Typical range for industrial laser cleaning of softwoods like cedar to remove contaminants without charring; starting at 100 W allows controlled ablation. Max avoids thermal damage threshold (~300 W at 1064 nm). Source: Manufacturer specs from IPG Photonics YLR series for wood applications; academic paper on wood surface cleaning (Opt. Lasers Eng., 2018).
Near-infrared wavelength for optimal Cedar absorption and minimal penetration
Optimal beam diameter for precision cleaning of Cedar grain patterns
High repetition rate for uniform cleaning coverage on Cedar surfaces
Short pulse duration for efficient ablation of contaminants without excessive heat diffusion
Scanning speed for efficient area coverage while maintaining cleaning effectiveness
Number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal from Cedar surface
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive energy deposition
